intro: Senecio onae, commonly known as the Onae's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white or gray hairs. Senecio onae produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, making it a distinctive member of its genus.
